content.title: General
content.desc: These general and simple kaomoji greetings listed below are easy and you can find one that you like quickly. For when you want to say a quick hey!

content.title: Hello
content.desc:
To say hello, hi, hey etc use these, of course you can replace the phrases with your own in any language. Here are some Japanese examples: 
こんにちは = Hello (konichiwa)
やあ = Hi (ya)
お久しぶりですね = Long time no see (O-hisashiburi desu ne)
よー！= Yo!

content.title: Thank You
content.desc:
Say thanks in a more meaningful way with these kaomoji that say thank you. Here are some Japanese examples:
ありがとう = Thank you (Arigatō)
どうも = Thanks (Domo)
すみません = Excuse Me (Sumimasen)

content.title: Good Morning
content.desc: Still sleepy and yawning? Display your tiredness by using some of these “Good Morning” or おはようございます (Ohayou gozaimasu) kaomoji. Or, if you’re an alien and are somehow a morning person, you can use a more cheerful option.

content.title: Good Night
content.desc:
Calling it a night after a long day? Sleepy? Use one these nighttime Kaomoji greetings to say farewell to your online friends.
Here are some Good Night greetings in Japanese: Good Evening:こんばんは (Konbanwa) & Goodnight: おやすみなさい (Oyasumi nasai).

content.title: Salute
content.desc: These cute salute emojis are for phrases such as “Yes sir!” or “I’m working on it! ( ・∀・ )ゞ ” and can be serious or in jest. You can turn other kaomoji into a salute easily by adding “ゞ, ゝ”, ゝ and ∠” characters.

content.title: Waving
content.desc: There are so many waving kaomoji, you can turn any of these into whichever greeting you want by adding phrases such as “Over here!”, “HEY YOU” and “Here”. You could be waving hello or goodbye, or just waving…

content.title: Simple Kaomoji Bears
content.desc: We love these Kaomoji bears so much we used one as our website logo. It’s the most popular bear using ʕ and ʔ for ears. These cute bear emojis are perfect for bear lovers everywhere. <3

content.title: Big Nose Bears
content.desc: Big cute bears use ㉨ for the nose. These grumpy looking bears are for looking extra serious or bored.

content.title: Fat Bears
content.desc: The original Japanese bear kaomoji. These bears look chubby and cute (●゜㉨　゜●). These wide bears have a resigned looking face, like whatever.

content.title: Simple Kaomoji Cats
content.desc: These simple kitty emoticons are easy to make, she has ^^ ears and = whiskers. Use ﾉ or ∫ as a tail and つ as paws.

content.title: Big Eye Cats
content.desc: These slightly creepy or caffeinated looking cats have big eyes using Φ ⓛ or ↀ!

content.title: Big Ear Cats
content.desc: A little grumpy looking kitty cat with prominent ears using /ᐠ and ᐟ\ !

content.title: Neko Cats
content.desc: Close up cats using the ᆽ and 🝦 character. These Kaomoji cats are aggressive and in your face, like most cats really.

content.title: ⓛⰙⓛฅ Meow Cats
content.desc: These kitties use ⱉ and Ⱉ as open mouths!

content.title: Basic Kaomoji Dogs
content.desc: Some simple Kaomoji dogs, using ▼, V and U for ears. Ruff!

content.title: Floppy Eared Dogs
content.desc: Floppy eared doggos. These look like Pompompurin (Sanrio’s Pudding Dog) and also Isabelle from the Animal Crossing game. ૮₍ ᵔ ꈊ ᵔ ⑅₎ა

content.title: Poodles
content.desc: Poodles or dogs with snouts (੯) and fluffy ears (໒꒱).

content.title: Kaomoji Bunny Rabbits
content.desc: Super cute Kaomoji bunny rabbits. You can use ᐢ, ⋂, and ᕱ for the bunny ears.

content.title: Lop Ear Bunny Kaomoji
content.desc: These floppy eared rabbits use the slash ／and ＼ for ears. You can combine the ones above to make more cute rabbit emoticons! ₍ᐢ＞×＜ᐢ₎ and add bows ⑅.

content.title: Bats Kaomoji
content.desc: Kaomoji bats for Halloween or whenever you want to suck some blood. OOOoooOOoooOOoooo!

content.title: Birds Kaomoji
content.desc: Hen-lo! Use these bird emoticons when you feel extra peckish. Sorry that was bad. These bird Kaomoji can be owls, parrots and any kind of birb.

content.title: Fish Kaomoji
content.desc: Kaomoji fish, shrimp and even crabs. When you’re feeling nautical or just hungry, use these seafood animals or sea creature emoticons.

content.title: Frog Kaomoji
content.desc: Ribbit ribbit! CROAK! hop. Frogs for you and your friends.

content.title: Mouse Kaomoji
content.desc: Cute little mice! These Kaomoji can also be hamsters, rats and other rodents.

content.title: Pig Kaomoji
content.desc: Use these little piggy Kaomoji when you are well, being a piggy. OINK!

content.title: Sheep Kaomoji
content.desc: Baa! Here are some sheep or ram Kaomoji using the Ꮚ character as ears.

content.title: Spider Kaomoji
content.desc: Spooders for all your creepy spooder needs.

content.title: Angel / Fairy
content.desc: A cute little winged creature, with pretty wings it could be a fairy, chrub, angel or other magical being. Use the ʚ ɞ, ପ ଓ, 𓆩 𓆪 or ᜊ ᜊ symbols for each wing.

content.title: Happy
content.desc: When you’re in a good mood and you want to spread happiness, use these positive emotions Kaomoji.

content.title: Smug
content.desc: When you’re feeling smug or chuffed with yourself, use these happy with yourself Kaomojis.

content.title: Agreement
content.desc: Show how much you agree with someone. Or you want to say “Yes”! Agreeing isn’t always one of the most positive emotions, but I put it here anyway (^▽^)/ ʸᵉᔆᵎ

content.title: Excited
content.desc: Are you super excited about something or celebrating something use these. Show your excitement with lots of grand arm motions ▒▒▓█▇▅▂∩( ✧Д✧)∩▂▅▇█▓▒▒

content.title: Hopeful
content.desc: Show your encouragement or hope for someone or something. You should encourage your friends when they need it. If you don’t, you will be sad and alone forever.

content.title: Love
content.desc: These love and kissing Kaomoji are for when you want to flirt or express your love and kissing feelings.

content.title: Blushing / Flattered / Shy
content.desc: For when you get a compliment. Or you’re just super happy! You might blush or faint if you’re embarrassed or self-conscious. These Kaomoji are also for shyness. (⌒_⌒;) Great for flirting too! ＊*♡( ⁎ᵕᴗᵕ⁎ ）

content.title: Thumbs up
content.desc: You can say YES, agree or approve with this thumbs up Kaomoji!

content.title: YATTA!
content.desc: “Yatta” or やった means yay! in Japanese.

content.title: Sympathy
content.desc: Sympathise with someone sad or worried by using these!

content.title: Laughing
content.desc: You’re either laughing happily or nervously or you are in tears laughing. Use these for those situations.

content.title: Sparkle
content.desc: See something you like or love? People get sparkles in their eyes when they are thinking or talking or hearing about something they are really happy about or love.

content.title: Success
content.desc: When someone is successful with their project, you can use these success Kaomoji

content.title: Anger
content.desc: When you are just flat out mad and want to express your absolute anger. If you’re angry it can really help to express how angry your are with these emoticons and work through it.
kaomoji: ┉┉┉-ˋˏ尺口卂尺ヾ(ꉺ ̱言 ꉺ )ﾉ 尺口卂尺ˎˊ-┉┉┉

content.title: Disapproval
content.desc: These general and simple kaomoji greetings listed below are easy and you can find one that you like quickly. For when you want to say a quick hey!

content.title: Thumbs Down
content.desc: Strongly disagree or disapprove with a thumbs-down. You can use some of the other negative Kaomoji on this page and add a p and q on either side for thumbs.

content.title: Disgust
content.desc: Similar to disapproval, disgust has an added yuck factor. When something is gross or disgusting, use these. Check out the vomit Kaomoji as well.

content.title: Sad Emojis
content.desc: Useful list of sad and unhappy emojis.

content.title: Unhappy
content.desc: These sad Kaomojis are for when you’re generally unhappy or grumpy or even disapproving!

content.title: Grumpy
content.desc: For when your pouting because you didn’t get what you wanted. Or you are grumpy because you’ve had a bad day.

content.title: Crying
content.desc: Are you super sad to the point of tears? You might cry? You can use the following crying Kaomojis to express your extreme sadness.

content.title: Depressed
content.desc: If you’re feeling down and depressed or just a bit grumpy use these.

content.title: ORZ – crying on your knees
content.desc: If you’ve just had it, use the ORZ kaomoji, for when you’re on your knees banging your head on the floor.

content.title: Hurt
content.desc: You can be hurt emotionally or physically, these in pain kaomoji are for those times.

content.title: Surprised
content.desc: When OMG isn’t enough, use these shocked and surprised kaomojis. Also check out our “Statements” page for OMG, WTF etc.

content.title: Confused
content.desc: When feeling what the heck, these are perfect Kaomoji to use. Confusion or what’s going on? What is happening??! Question marks all around.

content.title: Nervous
content.desc: Is your heart pounding with nervous worry? These are the kaomoji to use when you want to express feeling nervous or worried.

content.title: Doubtful
content.desc: If you’re skeptical about something, like yeah right. If you doubt what you’re being told, you can display your distrust or disbelief.

content.title: Fearful
content.desc: Afraid of what you just heard? If you fear the very fabric of time and space, use these fearful emotions. Or maybe someone scared you.

content.title: Worried
content.desc: Similar to being afraid, worried is a stressful emotion. So if your tearing your hear out or biting your nails, use these but also calm down (๑˃̵ᴗ˂̵)و Use these stressed Kaomoji to show your anxiety.

content.title: Hugging
content.desc: Send an affectionate action hug when someone is down or as a greeting. Cuddle your besties like there’s no tomorrow, because maybe there isn’t. 🥰

content.title: Kissing
content.desc: Kissing kaomoji for your loves. Sending a kiss is one of the best affectionate actions to use. Show how much you love and adore your friends, girlfriend, boyfriend or whatever.

content.title: Throwing kisses
content.desc: Throw a kiss to your friends, It’s less personal, more casual then actually kissing them!

content.title: Love Eyes
content.desc: For when you fall in love at first sight. Any kaomoji can be a love heart eyes emoticon, just replace the eyes with hearts! ♥♡♡❤

content.title: Romantic Text
content.desc: Some useful lovely text to use along with the kaomoji on this page.

content.title: Winking
content.desc: When you want to give someone a wink, it’s either affectionate, you know it’s iffy, or you’re being passive aggressive, wink wink ;).

content.title: Exercising
content.desc: When you exercise at the gym or you are lifting weights or showing off your biceps!

content.title: Dancing
content.desc: Show off your dance moves. Now.

content.title: Going Out
content.desc: Going out for drinks, getting coffee or tea in a cup or mug, these beverage Kaomojis are for those times.

content.title: Magic
content.desc: Turn others into frogs or whatever else with a magical spell Kaomoji! Put either a wand ━━★ or a wand with some sparkles ━━☆ﾟ. * ･ ｡ﾟ to other emoticons. You’re a wizard Harry.

content.title: Running
content.desc: RUN! Get out of there fast after using one of the fun running Kaomoji activities emoticons. Add the movement clouds ε=ε=ε=ε= or C= C= C= to other emoticons too! Escape from evil.

content.title: Singing & Music
content.desc: When you need to sing along to your favourite track use these singing and music Kaomoji! ♬♫♪◖(● o ●)◗♪♫♬

content.title: Sleeping
content.desc: If you’re sleepy and wish you were tucked up in bed snoozing away or if you’re super BORED of what your friend is nagging on about, use these sleep Kaomojis!

content.title: Writing
content.desc: Use the φ symbol as a hand with a pen! Write your name here.

content.title: Apologising / Bowing
content.desc: When apologising you can use these bowing down emoticons and say sorry with meaning.

content.title: Begging
content.desc: Similar to bowing or apologising, we just add some pleading hands (人).

content.title: Hiding
content.desc: Hiding or sneaking around a corner, or peeking around a door! Don’t be a creep hey.

content.title: Fall Down
content.desc: Why fall down? You can fall down in disbelief or be thrown by something someone says or does. Or your face is on the desk when you’re bored.

content.title: Pointing
content.desc: Point over to who actually did it. Point at your friends, enemies, frenemies and so on, if they deserve it.

content.title: Poking
content.desc: Poke your friends. Everyone likes it. Poking is similar to pointing above!

content.title: Roll Over
content.desc: Here are some fun rolling over Kaomoji actions.

content.title: Spin
content.desc: Here are some spinning Kaomojis, get dizzy.

content.title: Shrugging
content.desc: Shrug, who cares. You do, because you want to use a shrug emoticon.

content.title: Thinking
content.desc: Thinking… hmmm… what to think about. My mind is blank, so let’s think about thinking. (¯―¯٥)

content.title: Table Flip
content.desc: Theres a few reasons to flip a table, you could be mad or super happy! Also known as desk flips, rage flips and ちゃぶ台返し “Chabudai Gaeshi” which is “returning the tea table” in Japanese. Use these table flipping kaomojis so that no real tables need to be harmed.

content.title: Punching
content.desc: Punching, slapping or hitting emoticons for when you want to fight your friends or enemies. Use the و ง ڡ characters for fists. Probably the most violent of the aggressive actions, punch! slap! smack! wallop! boof!

content.title: Fighting
content.desc: Check out these fun fight emoticon sets for inspiration, you can create your own aggressive actions Komaoji easily, have a look at our Make Your Own Kaomoji page for more info!

content.title: Weapons
content.desc: Kaomoji wands, nun-chucks, swords and guns.

content.title: Eating & Food
content.desc: Everyone loves food right, eat up all the things. Use ♨ for hot food, 且 for a drink or tray of food and the ڡ character for a tongue mouth. Especially if it’s a yummy lunch, dinner, dessert, pudding or a snack!

content.title: Drooling / Thirsty
content.desc: Drooling when you’re hungry is normal yes? The ﹃ symbol is the perfect drool mouth. Is it actually one of the bodily functions? I guess… Thirst is not always about drinks though you know.

content.title: Hunger
content.desc: Urgh, I hate being hungry don’t you? The ۝ symbol is great for a hungry mouth as well as the ಕ ಕ eyes because you might be hangry. ( ಕ⸌۝⸍ಕ ) When you’re ravenous, peckish, suffering an extreme cookie craving, ໒( ́ ۝ ́ )७─∈

content.title: Licking Lips
content.desc: Seeing delicious food results in licking your lip doesn’t it. Lick them, lick everything. ok stop. (๑′ڡ‵๑)۶४४yϋᵐᵐӵ♡॰⋆

content.title: Nosebleed
content.desc: For when you hit your face. Yeah. Or when your nose is bleeding for some other reason you pervert.

content.title: Sneezing
content.desc: Sneeze your face off with these snotty Kaomoji, here have a tissue 🧻.

content.title: Sweat
content.desc: Sweating is a normal bodily function that sometimes happens, get over it. Or don’t, sweat harder. Use the ； or ; for sweat drops.

content.title: Vomit
content.desc: Feel like vomiting or throwing up? BllurrrGHHHHhhh! Use the 艸 for holding hands over your mouth. ( ﾟ ３ﾟ)≡@b͛͛͛a͛͛͛r͛͛͛f͛͛͛!

content.title: WOW
content.desc: When something is so surprising, awe inspiring, shocking, awful or amazing!

content.title: WTF
content.desc: What the actual #### or – GROSS!

content.title: Awkward
content.desc: When you want a hole to open up and swallow you up. Awkward moments are the worst.
kaomoji: pssSST( ﾟ∀(・－・) ᴵ ʷᵃᵗᶜʰᵉᵈ ʸᵒᵘ ˢˡᵉᵉᵖᶦⁿᵍ ˡᵃˢᵗ ⁿᶦᵍʰᵗ..~

content.title: Facepalm
content.desc: Smack! Did they really just say/do that! Ow. Urgh.

content.title: Middle Finger
content.desc: Up yours. Stick it where the sun don’t shine. Right up there!
kaomoji: 凸〳 ಥ ڡ ಥ 〵凸

content.title: Friends Kaomoji
content.desc: You can combine any two face kaomoji together with hands between, such as 人, メ, 八 and 爻.

content.title: High Five
content.desc: Low five sly five hoe five… high five 人

content.title: Holding Hands
content.desc: Friends hold hands too, bro.

content.title: Cheering Up
content.desc: Cheer up – that phrase you love to hear – send this Kaomoji instead of saying the dreaded words of doom ( ‘́⌣’̀)

content.title: Enemies Kaomoji
content.desc: Meant jokingly ¬‿¬ for your frenemy or enemy or family member.

content.title: Birthday
content.desc: Use these b’day emoticons to celebrate birthdays, easily converted to anniversaries etc. Use 由 for a present and ┌iii┐for the cake!
kaomoji: ヾ(☆＾Д’)o*★*―たんじょぅび おめでとぅ―*☆*o(‘Д＾★)ﾉﾞ

content.title: Party
content.desc: A collections of fun Event Kaomojis & emoticons to use to describe a party or other gathering, festival or concert.

content.title: Christmas
content.desc: If you celebrate it, send your xmas cheer to others that do too.
kaomoji: *<(。´Д｀;)ノ=ε3｡o０(So many presents to give・・・)

content.title: Valentine’s Day
content.desc: That day, you know the one where you’re meant to give and receive chocolates, card and a present, haven’t heard of it? No, me neither.

content.title: New Years
content.desc: Some cute new years greetings!
kaomoji: (ｏ’∀’)ノ｡+｡ﾟ☆I wish you a happy new year☆ﾟ｡+｡ヽ(‘∀’ｏ)
m(-　-)m　今年もよろしくお願いいたします

content.title: Halloween
content.desc: Spooky Kaomojis and emoticons for the 31st October, some call it Samhain… 🎃

content.title: General Cute Faces
content.desc: All of these Cute Kawaii Face Kaomojis are perfectly described as being “cute”.

content.title: Happy Flower Girl Emoticons
content.desc: The most popular happy emoticon variations.

content.title: Blushing Flower Girl
content.desc: She is blushing in a cute flower girl way.

content.title: Sad Flower Girl
content.desc: Careful now, if she’s sad she could cry and get angry too.

content.title: Angry Flower Girl
content.desc: What have you done… You can use ꐦ and ╬ to show anger. This mad flower girl Kaomoji is angry.

content.title: Yandere Flower Girl
content.desc: Here is the definition for Yandere on TV Tropes, basically a girl who becomes so in love to the point of sometimes violent obsession. Someone we can relate to but hopefully never take after.

content.title: Popular OwO Emoticons
content.desc: Some simple variations.

content.title: Different fonts and text styles
content.desc: Fun and creepy OwO emoticons, for trolling your friends!

content.title: OwO Kaomoji
content.desc: Here are the kaomoji versions, which are much cuter but still kind of creepy, or suggestive.

content.title: Popular UwU Emoticons
content.desc: Here are the simple variations of the uwu meme face text emoticon.

content.title: UwU Kaomoji
content.desc: Here are the kaomoji owo versions, which are much cuter!
